publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Frederick Smith (1773-1830) was Attorney General and Associate Justice of Pennsylvania. He was the son of the Reverend John Frederick Smith, an eminent divine of the Lutheran Church in Pennsylvania. He married Catharine Leaf, of Philadelphia. His two sons, Henry W. Smith, Esq., and George Smith, were prominent in the local affairs of Reading.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a commonplace book with addresses, poems, quotes, and extracts of essays and letters. Authors whose works are excerpted include Sheridan and Pitt. Several extracts are in German. The book includes a commencement address composed by Jacob Wagner, Jr., which was "intended to be delivered by F. Smith at his commencement in the University of Pennsylvania."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
